Nightshift tries to clear his mind before heading into the jungle.  He give=
s a thumbs up to give the all is good gesture as he returns to his premedit=
ation as they approach their destination.  As he remains tranquil, he balan=
ces a small ball bearing off of his right arm and skillfully rolls it over =
each and every finger, right to the fingertip and then flip the object into=
 his palm without a bounce or dropping it on the floor.  As the shuttle wen=
t over the turbulence, he still remains in perfect balance as the ball bear=
ing is rolled back around his shoulders and onto his left arm.  It finally =
gets balanced in his left hand.

" Balance over chaos.  When one can achiev=
e perfect balance within instability, he is ready to even the most uneven o=
f ground."

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Sep 1, 2011, =
at 2:29 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> The shuttle =
that NIGHTSHIFT is riding in moved swiftly towards the
> jungle, POLAR CLAW=
 sat in the pilot's chair with PROWL sitting next to
> him, both of them ke=
eping the ship on course. RAMULUS and WOLFGANG
> were sitting in the empty =
seats near NIGHTSHIFT taking turns watching
> him and then the outside of t=
he shuttle as it hurtled through the air.
> Occasionally they can feel a bi=
t of air turbulance in flight, but
> otherwise the trip is largely uneventu=
ful.
> 
> However as they drew closer to their destination WOLFGANG wistled=
,
> "Wow! How big is that thing?" He said as he got a look at the
> emmensi=
ty of the jungle they were moving towards.
> 
> PROWL answered. "Sensors in=
dicate that it is quite large. It is the
> area that will one day be known =
as the Amazon Basin. The Basin
> encompasses seven million kilometers, thou=
gh the forest itself
> occupies some 5.5 million kilometers."
> 
> "SLAG!" =
POLAR CLAW said from his seat.
> 
> PROWL turned to look at him, "What's wr=
ong?"
> 
> "Communications are getting spotty." He said as he tapped one of=
 the
> instruments as if that would turn the communication gear back on. He=

> shook his head as it had little affect.
> 
> "I am picking up some sort =
of energy field from the forest." PROWL
> said as he looked back at his ins=
truments. "It seems almost
> Unicronian."
> 
> There was a grunt from WOLFG=
ANG, "Seems like we are in for the hard
> stretch." He smiled, "I'm ready."=

> 
> There was a nod from RAMULUS as he looked out of the window as the
> =
Jungle was slowly getting closer and closer, but he said nothing.
> 
> "Alr=
ight! Listen up!" POLAR CLAW said, "If you have any last minute
> messages =
that need to be sent back to the Ark send 'em now. I am
> sending a update =
of everything we know. We are about to loose
> communications. Get ready."
=
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
>

<html><body bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF"><div>Nightshift tries to clear his mind bef=
ore heading into the jungle.  He gives a thumbs up to give the all is =
good gesture as he returns to his premeditation as they approach their dest=
ination.  As he remains tranquil, he balances a small ball bearing off=
 of his right arm and skillfully rolls it over each and every finger, right=
 to the fingertip and then flip the object into his palm without a bounce o=
r dropping it on the floor.  As the shuttle went over the turbulence, =
he still remains in perfect balance as the ball bearing is rolled back arou=
nd his shoulders and onto his left arm.  It finally gets balanced in h=
is left hand.</div><div><br></div><div>" Balance over chaos.  When one=
 can achieve perfect balance within instability, he is ready to even the mo=
st uneven of ground."<br><br>Perpetually on the move and constantly busy.&n=
bsp;</div><div><br>On Sep 1, 2011, at 2:29 PM, Super Cyclonus <<a href=
=3D"mailto:supercyclonus@...">supercyclonus@...</a>> wrote:<=
br><br></div><div></div><blockquote type=3D"cite"><div>




<span style=3D"=
display:none"> </span>



    <div id=3D"ygrp-text">
      
      
   =
   <p>The shuttle that NIGHTSHIFT is riding in moved swiftly towards the<br=
>
jungle, POLAR CLAW sat in the pilot's chair with PROWL sitting next to<br=
>
him, both of them keeping the ship on course. RAMULUS and WOLFGANG<br>
we=
re sitting in the empty seats near NIGHTSHIFT taking turns watching<br>
him=
 and then the outside of the shuttle as it hurtled through the air.<br>
Occ=
asionally they can feel a bit of air turbulance in flight, but<br>
otherwis=
e the trip is largely uneventuful.<br>
<br>
However as they drew closer to =
their destination WOLFGANG wistled,<br>
"Wow! How big is that thing?" He sa=
id as he got a look at the<br>
emmensity of the jungle they were moving tow=
ards.<br>
<br>
PROWL answered. "Sensors indicate that it is quite large. It=
 is the<br>
area that will one day be known as the Amazon Basin. The Basin<=
br>
encompasses seven million kilometers, though the forest itself<br>
occu=
pies some 5.5 million kilometers."<br>
<br>
"SLAG!" POLAR CLAW said from hi=
s seat.<br>
<br>
PROWL turned to look at him, "What's wrong?"<br>
<br>
"Com=
munications are getting spotty." He said as he tapped one of the<br>
instru=
ments as if that would turn the communication gear back on. He<br>
shook hi=
s head as it had little affect.<br>
<br>
"I am picking up some sort of ener=
gy field from the forest." PROWL<br>
said as he looked back at his instrume=
nts. "It seems almost<br>
Unicronian."<br>
<br>
There was a grunt from WOLF=
GANG, "Seems like we are in for the hard<br>
stretch." He smiled, "I'm read=
y."<br>
<br>
There was a nod from RAMULUS as he looked out of the window as=
 the<br>
Jungle was slowly getting closer and closer, but he said nothing.<=
br>
<br>
"Alright! Listen up!" POLAR CLAW said, "If you have any last minut=
e<br>
messages that need to be sent back to the Ark send 'em now. I am<br>
=
sending a update of everything we know. We are about to loose<br>
communica=
tions. Get ready."<br>
<br>
(TAG)<br>
<br>
Preston<br>
</p>

    </div>
